version_description: Fix IOS7 Bugs.

Hi Pacers,

A few bug fixes and a few new features for the awesomest user community on the planet:
1. Lots of under under-the-hood improvements in this update. Improvements made to app stability, battery use and the Apple Health sync.
2. New public groups. Public groups can be searched by name or location, and can hold up to 100 members.
3. All groups now support posting messages and images
4. Your profile now supports uploading a profile pic--but don't worry, you can still keep your avatar if you want :)
5. New profile page lets you keep track of all your check-ins, posts and likes in one place

As always, please keep the feedback coming. Hope you enjoy!

Just a few minor fixes here:
1. Fixed a bug where app was using too much battery in some cases
2. Improvements to step counting stability on iPhone 4,4s,5 and 5c
3. Fixed bug where syncing with Health would freeze up at 30%
4. Fixed some other Health data syncing bugs

iPhone 4, 4s, 5, 5c users please remember to open up Pacer after you've upgraded so that it can keep tracking your steps.
Bug fixes.

Hi there Pacer Community!

Here are the new features we have brought in with the past two versions (3.5.10 and 3.5.11),
A better Me page design that help you to see your data more clearly and easily! Btw, we had moved the steps global benchmark to the left of the Most Steps in a Day Cell.
A brand new Message Center on the top left of each page, and this will become your center for all messages from Pacer community and your AI weight loss coach. Of course, you can always turn the message notifications off by setting them inside the Message center settings which is located on the top right of that page.

Bug Fixes (3.5.10 and 3.5.11):
We fixed a bug that will trigger more battery consumption due to unnecessary location update.
We fixed some stability issues on iPhone 4, 4s, 5 and 5c.
And other bugs as well.

iPhone 4, 4s, 5, 5c users please remember to open up Pacer after you've upgraded so that it can keep tracking your steps.

Big News in this release! Now you can set up automatic backups for your Pacer data, so you don't have to worry about losing your data if anything happens to your phone. Just go to the 'Me' page and look for 'Backup My Data' at the bottom to set it up. You'll need to create an account so we can verify your identity later if you need to restore your data.

Also, some bug fixes and performance improvements.

As always, iPhone 4s, 5, 5c users please remember to re-open Pacer after you update so that we can continue tracking your steps.

Hey all you Pacers! Minor update:
1. Performance improvements and some bug fixes
2. Better flow for attaching multiple pictures to your check-in notes
3. All groups will now receive a link to a weekly data report. Check out your group chats to try it out!
4. Lots of minor UI improvements here and there

Much more coming soon!

Reminder to iPhone 4s, 5, 5c users to please re-open Pacer after you update so that we can continue to track your steps.

Hey Pacers! A big update to our GPS exercise feature:
-Major improvements to stability and accuracy
-Added pace and elevation charts
-New session summary UI, hope you like it :)

For Premium users, we've also added new do-at-home workouts to go along with the existing cardio workouts. These workouts are specifically designed to boost metabolism and build strength so you can reach your goals faster. In keeping with the spirit of Pacer, these workouts are

-require no additional equipment

Much more coming soon!

Hi Pacers. Thanks for your great feedback! Get even more motivation to get active and feel great with Regional Challenge Leaderboards. Challenges are more fun now that you can see how you stand against Pacers from your area as well as worldwide.

We’ve also made Pacer for Teams more convenient by allowing users to directly join your organization. We work to make fitness simple and easy, and joining your team is the first step!

Make sure to update to iOS 11! Stay active, stay motivated, and start getting ready for fall and winter!

Hi Pacers! Pacer is now more social, and you can get rewarded for inviting friends! It’s now easier to invite your friends to Pacer, and when 3 friends you invite join you’ll get a free Pacer Premium Membership! You can now also search for your Facebook Friends and phone contacts in Pacer, so you can get active together.

We’ve also introduced a new “Feed” page to make it easier to follow your Pacer friends and connect with the Pacer community. Share your status and activities, GPS results and more to your feed and followers. To accommodate these changes, the “Plan” and “Goal” pages have been moved to the “Me” tab. “Feed” is now located where “Plan” used to be.

Bugs have been fixed and other performance improvements have been made. Stay active, be social and get fit with your friends, family and new followers. See you on your Pacer Feed!

Hey Pacers! We’re introducing new personalized 12-week fitness plans! Get daily strength or cardio workouts to lose weight, get stronger or stay active. Each plan was designed by a professional coach, and comes with step-by-step video or audio guided workouts so anyone can start - no experience required.

We’ve also squashed some bugs, improved our tracking accuracy and more. Keep active, keep moving and you’ll reach your fitness goals sooner than you think. Update today!

Hey Pacers! We’ve made your historical data easier to view by turning the “Trends” tab into “Insights”. View 1-week/1-month/6-months/lifetime stats without having to tilt your screen. You can also organize your charts to feature the ones most important to you. We’ve also changed the “Me” page so it’s focused on you and your Pacer history! The “Me” tab now shows your Feed posts and your step/run/workout history. See your Pacer experience in one easy page.

We’ve also fixed some minor bugs and streamlined some features. Update your Pacer today!

Note: Fixed a problem where the “Average” data was showing up incorrectly for some users.

Hello Pacers! You can now share your achievements to your Pacer Feed automatically! When you earn a new badge, join a challenge or join a group, Pacer can post to your Feed automatically. You can also view Auto Posts from your friends and followers. Don’t want to post or view Auto Posts? No problem! Adjust your settings you so post and view only the types that you want.

The new update also makes several minor improvements and fixes issues. Make sure to upgrade today for the best Pacer experience!

Hey Pacers! Pacer Premium users can now compare your steps against a variety of segments of the Pacer Community! See how your steps match up against other Pacers based on their age, region and more. We’ve also made improvements to the Insights Page for a better Insights experience. This also means you can now manage your progress towards a weight loss goal from Insights! Finally, you can now set your Pacer account to Private. Accounts set to Private can only be viewed by followers that you approve, giving you more privacy when you want it.

We’ve also made additional minor improvements and fixes, so make sure to update today for the best Pacer experience!

Fixed a problem in 3.8.3 where posts with pictures could be posted but pictures could not be displayed.

Hello Pacers! Create your own fun, motivational challenges or share your location for peace of mind while walking. Introducing Challenge Friends & Pacer Live Tracking!

* Challenge Friends: Create your own Weekday or Weekend challenge and invite your friends. Have fun, get motivated to walk more and compete against your friends to see who can take the most steps!

* Live Tracking: Share your location with up to 3 friends. Live Tracking allows your friends or family to follow you with a web browser interface and follow your location, distance and even phone battery level. Use it so your loved ones know where you are during activities or to meet up with walking buddies.

Bugs have been stepped on and performance has improved, so make sure to update today!

Hey Pacers! We’re bringing you a whole new way to record, share & add photos to your GPS activities and a whole new way to connect with those you care about most.

Recording & sharing GPS activities is easier and more interactive!
• Take photos using Pacer or your Camera. When you share your GPS activity, Pacer can automatically show where the photos were taken!
• Share your activity track, map, photos and more – not just screenshots!
• Get more likes and comments when you share GPS activities!

Favorites: Pacer’s new Favorites lets you connect with the people closest to you to follow their progress and give instant support
• Add up to 5 of your friends and loved ones to Favorites
• Check their steps with just 1 click from the home screen
• Give them likes for instant support

1. GPS Sharing Privacy Settings: It's now easier to choose to whether to share your GPS activities with followers, everyone, or not share them at all.

2. New Pacer Routes: Introduce your favorite walking trail or local area to your friends! Routes turns your GPS activity's track into a Route that your friends can navigate. Don’t forget to take photos during your activity - they can be added to the Route so your friends can see all of the interesting sights along the way!

Hello Pacers! Join our new Routes Challenges and compete for a place in our yearly Routes Hall of Fame. The workout page is also completely redesigned, with great new workouts and a better interface.

New Routes Challenges:
*Earn brand new Routes Badges by creating the most quality Routes from GPS tracks

Routes Hall of Fame:
*Special recognition for the top route creators over the entire year

New and Improved Pacer Workouts:
*We've redesigned the workout page with all new Mindful Walks and new workout categories that make it easier to build strength or burn calories.

Hey Pacers! We’ve made social participation in our Pacer community safer and more secure. Our groups interface now looks and performs better too!

Community safety and authenticity:

* Added additional email verification step required to use social features

* Closed potential loopholes to reduce cheating in Pacer challenges.

Improved groups interface

* The Pacer groups interface looks better and loads and performs faster.

We’ve also fixed some minor bugs, so make sure to update to the latest version of Pacer today.

Apple Watch Supported:
Watch users can now add a Pacer complication to your Apple Watch! View your steps on your watch face, and click to see a Pacer interface with your progress towards your Pacer step goal.

Trim Routes:
You can now trim your Routes to adjust the starting and ending points. Create better Routes out of the best parts of your walks and set the start point to a public area for increased privacy. You can also now post routes anonymously!

We’ve made some other minor improvements, so make sure to update to the new version today. Happy walking!

* Re-categorized GPS activities: you can now choose among walk, hike, run and ride;
* More accurate calories burned: elevation climbing and flights are now taken into account;
* Enhanced GPS tracking: display current elevation, bearing, and coordinates when recording a hike;
* Redesigned “Share a route” process. You can now show off or recommend a route in an easier and cooler way;
* New privacy options: more control over who can send you messages, and an easier way to block users

Pacer Routes are now even better! Create better looking, more informative routes from your favorite walking locations. You can publish Routes to show off your favorite walking paths to the Pacer community.

You can also discover Routes created by other Pacers from around the world. Find interesting walking locations published by real Pacers in your area or worldwide. Routes helps you find a better way to walk!

We’ve also many various minor improvements, so make sure to upgrade today.

Maps are much better!
Pacer's maps don't just look much better, but they're more useful and informative too! Choose between 4 styles - Streets, Outdoors, Satellite and Dark - when you record GPS activity or browsing Tracks and Routes.

Offline Routes
When you find a Route you like, you can download its map for offline use. No more worrying about losing your way if you enter a low cell-signal zone.
